greenmirror

Class FxWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • greenmirror.FxWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FxShapeWrapper, ImageFxWrapper

    public abstract class FxWrapper
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A wrapper class for handling JavaFX nodes. It registers virtual values of the properties of the FX node it holds. This is done so animations can be created (server side) without directly reading from or writing to the relevant FX node. Furthermore, it contains auxiliary methods for usage by its subclasses.

    Adding a new FxWrapper

    1. Create a new subclass of FxWrapper or FxShapeWrapper.
    2. Implement and override all relevant methods.
    3. Add the properties you want (see below).
    4. Add the new binary class name on a new line to META-INF/services/greenmirror.FxWrapper.
    5. Recompile.

    Adding properties to an FxWrapper

    1. Create a new FxPropertyWrapper if it doesn't exist yet.
    2. Add the property to getAnimatableProperties() or getChangableProperties().
    3. Add getter(s).
    4. Add setter(s).
    5. If your property can be animated (and thus you added it to getAnimatableProperties()) and it hasn't got an Animation for it yet, create it. For examples, see FxWrapper.RotateTransition and ImageFxWrapper.ImageTransition.
    6. If your property can be animated, add animate method(s) (like animatePROPERTY(double, Duration)) that create the animations that change the property value on the FX node.
    7. If the user needs to create instances of new types in his Groovy script to make use of the property, add an import to GroovyScriptModelInitializer.IMPORTS.
    8. Recompile.
    A property can thus be one of two types:
    • a property that can be set only once (e.g.: the style property of any JavaFX node). This is because the property then can not be animated. Follow steps 1-4 and 7 and 8 of the above list. In a Groovy script it can only be set by first creating the node and its FX appearance and then adding it to GreenMirror (by using addNode(Node) or addNodes(Node...)).
    • a property that can be set and changed (e.g.: the rotate property of any JavaFX node). This means the property can be animated. Follow all steps of the above list.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

      • getX

        public abstract java.lang.Double getX()
        Returns the x coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Returns:
        the x coordinate of the origin

      • getY

        public abstract java.lang.Double getY()
        Returns the y coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the origin

      • toMap

        public @NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap()
        Returns a mapping of the properties of this FxWrapper that are defined in getChangableProperties(). This should contain all relevant information to construct the FX node. Every property's FxPropertyWrapper determines how the values will be mapped.
        Returns:
        a map of this FxWrapper's properties

      • toMapWithoutPositionData

        public @NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMapWithoutPositionData()
        Returns the result of toMap() without any positioning data. It removes x, y, z, centerX, centerY and centerZ. If a subclass has other positioning data, it should override this method and remove the relevant data.
        Returns:
        the property map of this FxWrapper without positioning data
        See Also:
        toMap()

      • toString

        public @NonNull java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string description of this FxWrapper. It retrieves the map of all properties, removes any image values (because that would mean a long base64 encoded string) and returns a string representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this FxWrapper

      • isPositionSet

        public boolean isPositionSet()
        Checks if the position of the FX node was set. It checks if the x and y coordinates are set.
        Returns:
        true if the position was set

      • getPointAdjustedForRotation

        public @NonNull javafx.geometry.Point3D getPointAdjustedForRotation(@NonNull javafx.geometry.Point3D obj)
        Calculate the adjustment for a point relative to the middle point of the current node.
        Parameters:
        obj - the point relative to the middle point of the current node. Only the x and y coordinates are taken into account.
        Returns:
        the new point

      • calculatePoint

        public abstract @NonNull javafx.geometry.Point3D calculatePoint(@NonNull Placement placement)
        Calculates the absolute point with of a specified Placement on the JavaFX node. E.g.: if this is a RectangleFxWrapper representing a 100x100 rectangle at position (10,10) of the canvas, calculatePoint(Placement.MIDDLE) would result in point (60,60).
        Parameters:
        placement - the position of placement which should be calculated.
        Returns:
        the absolute point

      • setRotate

        public @NonNull FxWrapper setRotate(double value)
        Sets the virtual rotation of the JavaFX node and notifies the observer (the GreenMirror node, if this FxWrapper is part of a GreenMirror node).
        Parameters:
        value - the new rotation in degrees
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        Node.setRotate(double)

        Parameters:
        value - the rotation to add to the current rotation (in degrees)
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:

      • setOpacity

        public @NonNull FxWrapper setOpacity(double value)
        Sets the virtual opacity of the JavaFX node and notifies the observer (the GreenMirror node, if this FxWrapper is part of a GreenMirror node). The opacity should be a value between (and including) 0 and 1.0.
        Parameters:
        value - the new opacity
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the received value was invalid.
        See Also:
        Node.setOpacity(double)

      • animateRotate

        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        See Also:

      • animateOpacity

        public @NonNull FxWrapper.FadeTransition animateOpacity(double value,
                                                        @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates the animation that changes the opacity property of the JavaFX node to value.
        Parameters:
        value - the opacity to change to. This has to be a value between (and including) 0 and 1.0.
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is invalid
        See Also:
        FxWrapper.FadeTransition

      • animateOpacity

        public @NonNull FxWrapper.FadeTransition animateOpacity(double fromValue,
                                                        double toValue,
                                                        @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates the animation that changes the opacity property of the JavaFX node from fromValue to toValue.
        Parameters:
        fromValue - the opacity to change to. This has to be a value between (and including) 0 and 1.0.
        toValue - the opacity to change to. This has to be a value between (and including) 0 and 1.0.
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fromValue or toValue is invalid
        See Also:
        animateOpacity(double, Duration), FxWrapper.FadeTransition

      • calculatePointOnRectangle

        public static @NonNull javafx.geometry.Point3D calculatePointOnRectangle(double width,
                                                                         double height,
                                                                         @NonNull Placement placement)
        Calculates the coordinates of a placement on a rectangle given the width and height of the rectangle. The origin of the coordinate system of the returned point lies in the upper left corner of the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        placement - the placement on the rectangle
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the placement relative to the origin of the rectangle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width or height is negative
        See Also:
        Placement

      • getNewInstance

        public static @NonNull FxWrapper getNewInstance(@NonNull java.lang.String type)
        Returns a new FxWrapper instance. On the first call, a set of prototypes of all available FxWrappers is created by using ServiceLoader. This method returns a clone of the prototype of the type passed via type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type, which should be the same as the class name in the greenmirror.fxwrappers package, appended with FxWrapper. The first letter will be capitalized.
        Returns:
        the new instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed type is invalid
        See Also:
        FxWrapper, ServiceLoader

      • animateFromMap

        public @NonNull javafx.animation.ParallelTransition animateFromMap(@NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> newValuesMap,
                                                                   @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates animations from a property-value map (from a JSON object, for example). The animations are stored in a ParallelTransition, so they're all applied concurrently.

        Only properties from getAnimatableProperties() can be animated. If others are present in newValuesMap they're ignored.

        Parameters:
        newValuesMap - the map with property-value pairs
        duration - the total duration for the animations
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the changes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() returns null
